commitResults.messageTitle: Add Job Title field to Application
commitResults.messageBody:
Job Title field is required in job application to denote the job the
application is for.

Adding the Job Title field also requires the addition of the JobTitle
class, job title in the GUI, modifying the add command to take in
job title and modifications to the storage.

Let's also add 2 additional test cases for testing the add command with
the job title parameter as well as updating test data and test cases
to account for the Job Title field.

Note:
EditCommand is modified but does not allow editing job title.

commitResults.messageBody:
Added cli syntax (idt/) for interview slot.

Updated edit command and its parser to support interview slot field.

Added default value for add command to to support interview slot field.
The interview slot cannot be set during the creation of the internship
application, thus it is defaulted to default constructor.

Changes were made to accommodate newly added interview slot data.

As a step towards the demo, data has been updated to realistic data.
Doing so will provide us a more realistic preview of the application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update json adapter to support InterviewSlot field
Update Ui to support IntervieSlot field
commitResults.messageBody:
Added interview slot to ui.

Move job title field to first field for better user experience. This
allows to user to see the job title immediately after the company.

Interview slot class equals() function was previously compared to an
instance of phone class resulting in errors in testcases.

Update to reflect correctly to compare value of interview slot.

A string comparison is more friendly due to parsing limitation
that truncated the default placeholder value - maximum value of
LocalDateTime class.

"Person" directory is currently named "Person" following AB3's
original purpose as an address book application.

InternApply is an application that handles the tracking of
internship "Application", not "Person".

Let's rename the directory to better reflect the purpose of the
"Person" class in InternApply.

A simple refactoring will suffice.

InternApply is still able to succesfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:248 of 248 tests)

"Person" class was implemented following AB3's original purpose
as an address book application.

"Person" class is already making use of AB3's existing code base and
logic. Renaming and repurposing the "Person" class for our own
"Application" class would save us time having to reimplement
existing logic in "Person" class to make use of AB3's features.

Let's morph "Person" class and into an "Application" class starting
with renaming the "Person" to "Application".

A simple refactoring will suffice.

InternApply is still able to succesfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:248 of 248 tests)

Following the repurposing of "Person" class to "Application" class,
the JavaDoc of the class has become irrelevant.

JavaDoc inaccuracies need to be addressed so that developers reading
our code can have a better understanding.

Let's update the JavaDoc of "Application" class.

Going through and updating the JavaDoc in "Application" class will
suffice.

The JavaDoc for "tags" Data Field in this class is left as W.I.P;
Following the implementation of future tags this JavaDoc will be
updated.

The method isSamePerson() has also been refactored to
isSameApplication() however the implementation of this method will
need to be reviewed on a later date.

JavaDoc for isSameApplication() was missed in previous commit.

Let's update the JavaDoc for this method to reflect the change from
"Person" to "Application".

Implementation of the method has not been reviewed at this point.
isSameApplication() currently still checks the "name" data field to
determine if 2 applications are considered the same.

"UniquePersonsList" class is support for "Person" class that helped
ensure the list of Persons stored in AB3 is kept unique and without
duplications. It also supported a minimal set of list operations.

"Application" class will also need this support.

Let's morph "UniquePersonsList" class into "UniqueApplicationList"
class starting.

A simple refactoring will suffice.

InternApply is still able to succesfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:248 of 248 tests)

The JavaDoc for this class has also been updated in this commit. The
methods in "UniquePersonsList" have also been renamed to better
reflect their new purpose as support for the "Applications" class.

This commit also includes the renaming of "PersonsNotFoundException"
to "ApplicationsNotFoundExceptions" and "DuplicatePersonsException"
to "DuplicateApplicationsException".

Following the repurposing of "Person" class to "Application" class,
the JavaDoc of the class has become irrelevant.

JavaDoc inaccuracies need to be addressed so that developers reading
our code can have a better understanding.

Let's update the JavaDoc of "NameContainsKeywordsPredicate" class.

Going through and updating the JavaDoc in
"NameContainsKeywordsPredicate" class will suffice.

Methods and purpose of this class have been left untouched. This
class is meant as part of the logic needed for the "find" command
in AB3.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated the following classes to meet checkstylemain requirements.
Updated the following classes to meet checkstyletest requirements.
AddressBookParser class: parseCommand() method now no longer recognizes the "edit" command
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, InternApply still accepts "edit" as a keyword.

For v1.2 of InternApply, this functionality is outside the scope of
the iteration.

Let's just disable the command by making AddressBookParser not
recognize "edit" as a keyword.

This will be done by simply commenting out the relevant switch-case
statement in the parseCommand() method in the AddressBookParser
class.

This will suffice since we do plan to implement this function in
future iterations of InternApply.

Non of the classes created to support the "edit" command has been
removed.

Instead, they will be updated in the future iterations of
InternApply.

Both classes are still using naming from AB3 codebase.

The methods found in these classes are badly named in the context
of InternApply.

Let's update the methods found in "Logic" and "LogicManager".

A simple refactoring will suffice since we are still going to reuse
the method implementation from AB3 in InterApply.

InternApply is still able to succesfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:248 of 248 tests).

"AddressBookParser" is a class from the AB3 code base. Currently,
it's named with the purpose of supporting AB3 development as an
address book.

Since we are morhping AB3 to InternApply to track Internship
applications, this class needs to be morphed as well.

Let's morph "AddressBookParser" to "InternApplyParser"
class.

A simple refactoring will suffice.

InternApply is still able to succesfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:248 of 248 tests)

The implementation of methods in this class have not been changed.

As a by-product of this change, there has been a renaming of
"AddressBookParserTest" to "InternApplyParserTest" as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: "AddressBookParserTest" class: removed an existing test case.
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the app still tests for the "edit" command.

However, it has already been decided that the "edit" functionality
will be disabled for v1.2 iteration of InternApply.

Let's just remove the "edit" command test from the test class.

We will comment out the test case so that it is ignored for v1.2
testing.

The "editCommand" test has been left alone since support for "edit"
functionality still exists but just disabled such that InternApply
will not recognize the "edit" command.

Hence why only the "edit" test case in "AddressBookParserTest" is
being disabled.

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently the USERGUIDE_URL still refers users to the AB3 UserGuide
website when users are looking for help.

Since we have already created out own website for InternApply's
UserGuide, we should be referring users to that link instead.

Let's update the USERGUIDE_URL so that it prints InternApply's
UserGuide website instead.

(Line 18) The attribute USERGUIDE_URL that contained the link to
AB3's UserGuide has been replaced with the link that takes users to
InternApply's UserGuide.

This does not affect any other part of the code or commands.

"PersonListPanel" is a class from the AB3 code base. Currently,
it's named with the purpose of supporting AB3 development as an
address book.

Since we are morphing AB3 to InternApply to track Internship
applications, this class needs to be morphed as well.

Let's start by renaming "PersonListPanel" to "ApplicationListPanel".

A simple refactoring will suffice for this.

InternApply is still able to succesfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:251 of 251 tests)

PersonListPanel.fxml is file from the AB3 code base. Currently,
it's named with the purpose of supporting AB3 development as an
address book, particularly the GUI component.

Since we are morphing AB3 to InternApply to track Internship
applications, this file is redundant as is.

Let's repurpose PersonListPanel.fxml to ApplicationListPanel.fxml.

A simple refactoring will suffice as well as the updating the
contents of the file.

Particularly, the "fx:id=" in Line 7 has been updated from
"personListView" to "applicationListView".

InternApply is still able to succesfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:251 of 251 tests)

The class that makes reference to this fxml file,
ApplicationListPanel.java, has also been updated. (Line 17)

Currently, it still uses "personListView" as the @FXML attribute.

But this is no longer working resulting in an error when running
the application.

The source of the bug is determined to be the changing of the
"fx:id=" to "applicationListView" from "personListView" in the
ApplicationListPanel.fxml file.

Let's also rename the affected @FXML attribute in the
"ApplicationListPanel" class.

InternApply is still able to successfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:251 of 251 tests)

This fixes the bug that prevents the application from opening.

Currently, "addressBookFilePath" specifies the name of the file the
app should search for on the user's local hard disk to load existing
data.

The file name as well as the name of the field is no longer relevant
in the context of InternApply.

Let's rename "addressBookFilePath" to "internApplyMemoryFilePath"
and also update the name of the json file from "addressbook.json" to
"internapplymemory.json".

These changes are reflected on Lines 17, 51, 56, 71 and 76.

InternApply now fails 2 of the 251 implemented tests
(Test passed:249 of 251 tests).

They are:
1. readUserPrefs_fileInOrder_successfullyRead()
2. readUserPrefs_extraValuesInFile_extraValuesIgnored()

This will need to be addressed in a later commit.

commitResults.messageTitle: "JsonUserPrefsStorageTest" class: updated method. ExtraValuesUserPref.json & TypicalUserPref.json: changes made.
commitResults.messageBody:
It's been identified that the two tests that are currently failing
have been implemented in the "JsonUserPrefsStorageTest" class.

However, these tests were created in the context of AB3 and as a
result, without modifications, they are failing.

Let's update these 2 specific tests to better reflect the changes
made in the previous commit.

In Line 76, we have changed the argument to
setInternApplyMemoryFilePath to the latest name
"internapplymemory.json".

Additionally, the 2 Json files that were created for the respective
tests have also been modified such that they now have the file path
"internApplyMemoryFilePath" that have the String value
"internapplymemory.json".

This modification better reflects the behavior of the app in the
current iteration.

InternApply is now able to successfully run all implemented tests
(Test passed:251 of 251 tests).

This commit directly addresses the issues #69 and #70 in the tP
repo.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated the following classes to meet checkstylemain requirements.

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the messages that are being printed when using the "add"
command are still in the context of an address book being used.

Since our application now deals with internship applications, these
messages are no longer relevant.

Let's change the messages for the "AddCommand" class.

All the relevant attributes in the class will be changed to reflect
the action of "adding a new application".

InternApply is still able to successfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:251 of 251 tests)

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated summary example used for add command to include the address parameter.
Update sample data so that user can see all the possible application status tags and priority tags.
Added additional FAQs to the FAQ section of the User Guide.
Update sample data since NOTAPPLIED is no longer recognized as a valid Applications Status.

commitResults.messageBody:
parese() method currently does not accept PREFIX_PRIORITY_TAG as a
valid input.

We want users to be able to use the edit command to edit the Priority
This reverts commit 78954c9f436d1815f56056221c889a6c1a495ee1.

parese() method currently does not recognize PREFIX_PRIORITY_TAG as
a valid input.

We want users to be able to use the edit command to edit the
Priority Tag of existing applications.

Let's modify the parse() method in "EditCommandParser" class to be
able to accept and handle PREFIX_PRIORITY_TAG as a valid input.

We will first modify the parse() method such that it
will look for PREFIX_PRIORITY_TAG when tokenizing it's input.

Next, we modify the existing parseTagsForEdit() method such that it
accounts for both generic tags that use PREFIX_TAG and Priority tags
that use PREFIX_PRIORITY_TAG.

Finally, we will abstract out a parseGenericTagsForEdit() method
that specifically parse out the generic tags from the input of
parse() method into a tagSet.

InternApply is still able to successfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:264 of 264 tests)

Right now, edit command recognizes "pt/". However, editing "t/"
and/or "pt/" will cause InternApply to wipe existing "t/", "pt/" and
"ast/" tags as well.

parese() method currently does not recognize
PREFIX_APPLICATION_STATUS_TAG as a valid input.

We want users to be able to use the edit command to edit the
Application Status Tag of existing applications.

Let's modify the parse() method in "EditCommandParser" class to be
able to accept and handle PREFIX_APPLICATION_STATUS_TAG as a valid
input.

We will first modify the parse() method such that it
will look for PREFIX_APPLICATION_STATUS_TAG when tokenizing it's
input.

Next, we modify the existing parseTagsForEdit() method such that it
accounts for Application Status tags that use
PREFIX_APPLICATION_STATUS_TAG.

InternApply is still able to successfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:264 of 264 tests)

Right now, edit command recognizes "ast/". However, editing "ast/"
will cause InternApply to wipe existing "t/", "pt/" and "ast/" tags
as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update the MESSAGE_USAGE field in "AddCommand" class.
Update the MESSAGE_USAGE field in "EditCommand" class.

commitResults.messageBody:
The way the edit command works currently is for a new application
to be be instantiated within the "EditCommand" that will the replace
the existing application at the given index.

This leads to a behavior in InternApply that causes it to wipe all
existing tags of an application when editing the tags of an
application.

Since we have expanded on the functionality of edit to allow users
to also edit application status and priority tag, this previously
acceptable behavior has become a problem akin to a bug.

We want users to be able to use the edit command to edit the
generic tags, Application Status Tag or Priority Tag of existing
applications without having to worry about reentering existing tags
that aren't being edited.

Let's modify the behavior of the edit command such that it knows
what tags are being modified and only overrides those tags in the
existing application while remembering to bring over the other tags
to the newly created application.

We will create a new method getTags() that now takes in the entire
Set<Tag> applicationToEditTags. If all three tags were left
unedited, we will simply copy the existing tags over to the new
application.

Otherwise, we want to reconstruct the Set<Tag> object such that it
contains both new tags and also remembering old tags that were not
touched.

For every tag (divided by prefix) we will first check if edits were
made by the user. If so, we will copy the new edits and override the
old ones. This behavior follows the current behavior of InternApply.

If InternApply cannot detect any edits made by the user, InternApply
will simply copy over the tags from the existing application.

In doing so, we ensure that InternApply only overrides relevant tags
that have been selected for edits by the user.

Due to the changes made, 1 of the test cases in the
"EditCommandTest" class is failing. A commit in the future will be
made to address this.

commitResults.messageTitle: The following changes were made to the test cases.
commitResults.messageBody:
InternApply is still able to successfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:264 of 264 tests).

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated the following classes to meet checkstylemain requirements.
Update DG for assigned features. This is only partially done.
Update DG for assigned features. This is the completed version.
Update DG for assigned features. Feature for editing Application Status and Priority Tag have already been implemented.
Update UG to reflect the changes made to `edit` command to accept pt/ and ast/ to edit the priority tag and application status tag, of a specified application, respectively.

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently there is no way for a user to easily check what are the
upcoming interviews that they have.

We want to provide this as a feature by implementing a new "reminder"
This reverts commit 8f065b60a7c020bc0af0e3704c967eef2b85f513.

Currently there is no way for a user to easily check what are the
upcoming interviews that they have.

We want to provide this as a feature by implementing a new
"reminder" command.

Let's start by creating a "ReminderCommand" class that extends the
"Command" class. Then update InternApplyParser#parseCommand() method
to recognize "reminder" as the keyword to call the command.

We will create a "ReminderCommand" class that extends "Command"
class.

Next, we include a case where "reminder" is detected as an input in
InternApplyParser#parseCommand().

InternApply is still able to successfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:264 of 264 tests).

Currently "ReminderCommand" has still not been fully implemented.

As such, users who use the command should be informed that this
command is still being implemented.

Let's create a placeholder message that gets given as a response
when users input this command.

We create a MESSAGE_NOT_IMPLEMENTED_YET String that gets used to
create the CommandResult when ReminderCommand#execute() is called.

InternApply is still able to successfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:264 of 264 tests).

Also create a MESSAGE_USAGE String for consistency. All command
classes have this message by default.

Currently, CommandResult constructor takes in two Boolean values
that represents if the CommandResult should show help or exit the
program.

"help" command would create a CommandResult that should show help
but not exit.

"exit" command would create a CommandResult that should exit but not
show help.

All other commands would create a CommandResult that should not show
help or exit.

"show help" here means to create the help window.

Since we are creating "reminder" command in a similar vein as "help"
command where we would like to create a reminder window we need to
recreate this behavior of "show reminder".

Let's modify the constructor for "CommandResult" class.

We will modify it such that it takes in a third Boolean named
showReminder that is only true when ReminderCommand#execute() is
called that creates a CommandResult.

InternApply is still able to successfully run all previously
implemented tests (Test passed:264 of 264 tests).

All instances of CommandResult being created have been updated as
such:

"help" command would create a CommandResult that should show help
but not show reminder or exit.

"exit" command would create a CommandResult that should exit and not
show help or reminder.

All other commands would create a CommandResult that should not show
help, show reminder or exit.

"reminder" command would create a CommandResult that should show
reminder but not show help or exit.

Additionally, all test cases that instantiates a CommandResult
object have been updated accordingly to the above mentioned
behavior.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create a new "ReminderCommandTest" class in the test folder. Semi-implement the "reminder" command. Update the "CommandResultTest" class to include lines to test for the new Boolean of "CommandResult".
commitResults.messageBody:
At this point, "reminder" command is still at the stage of not being
implemented.

We have already created a way for CommandResult to handle "reminder"
command's behavior so we can start implementing the command itself.

Let's start by semi-implementing the "reminder" command.

ReminderCommand#execute() has been modified to make use of the new
CommandResult constructor.

ReminderCommand#MESSAGE_NOT_IMPLEMENTED_YET has been replaced with
ReminderCommand#SHOWING_REMINDER_MESSAGE.

CommandResultTest#equals() and CommandResultTest#hashcode() have
both been updated to test the case where showReminder Boolean of a
CommandResult object is different.

A new "ReminderCommandTest" class has been created to test for the
successful creation of a ReminderCommand object.

InternApply now runs successfully run all 265 tests
(Test passed:265 of 265 tests).

Additional changes that was done in the previous commit but were not
mentioned:

CommandResult#isShowReminder() method was created.

CommandResult#equals() method was updated to check for showReminder
field.

CommandResult#hashcode() method was updated to also hash the
showReminder field.

Currently, calling the "reminder" command only returns a response
with text.

We want it such that a window with a list of upcoming interviews
show up in a pop-up window.

Let's implement the Ui support for the "reminder" command.

As a start, we will first be making a copy of the Ui support for
"help" command.

We will be building on this in future commits.

InternApply now runs successfully run all 265 tests
(Test passed:265 of 265 tests).

commitResults.messageTitle: Modified the contents of the reminder window for the "reminder" command.
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the reminder window only contains a short placeholder
message.

We want it such that a window with a list of applications with
upcoming interviews show up in the pop-up window.

Let's next make it such that the reminder window is populated with
a list of applications.

InternApply now runs successfully run all 265 tests
(Test passed:265 of 265 tests).

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the reminder window only contains a short placeholder
message.

We want it such that a window with a list of applications with
upcoming interviews show up in the pop-up window.

Let's next make it such that the reminder window is populated with
a list of applications.

InternApply now runs successfully run all 265 tests
(Test passed:265 of 265 tests).

commitResults.messageTitle: Add a way to customize startup behavior of InternApply.
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, on startup only the Main Window is created and open.

We want to be able to customize additional behaviors of InternApply
on startup.

Let's implement a way for us to run a code on startup before the
control is handed to the user and the application starts accepting
user input.

We can implement a MainWindow#init() method that is a void method
that just runs the specificed code.

We modify UiManager#start() method such that it now calls
MainWindow#init() before terminating and handing the control back
to MainApp#start().

InternApply now runs successfully run all 265 tests
(Test passed:265 of 265 tests).

For now, MainWindow#init() has been implemented such that it calls
"reminder" command.

Thus, on startup, the both the Main Window and Reminder Window will
be launched before control is given to the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases for "LogicManagerTest" and "ModelManagerTest" class in test folder.
Update library imports to match coding standards.

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the method is being used to create Sample Data that will
be used to populate InternApply's application list.

This method is only called if an existing internapplymemory.json
file is not detected in the data folder.

The Sample Data is a hard coded set of applications. This means that
the Interview Slots created are generally going to be irrelevant at
some point.

Let's implement a way to generate Interview Slots that are more
useful.

To do this, we want to check for the LocalDateTime.now() of the
local machine and use that to generate our Interview Slots.

This ensures that no matter which user is using InternApply or when
they are using InternApply, the Sample Data generated (if needed)
will be relevant relative to the actual current local date time of
his/her machine.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update UG, removed Ui.png, added MainWindowUi.png and ReminderWindowUi.png.
Update SampleData to contain more sensible data that would better serve as an example of how users can make use of SIA.

commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the method simply checks if the Collection of Strings
passed to it is null or not.

This means that even a Collection of empty Set<String> would pass
this check as a valid input.

Let's change this since an empty Set<String> not be meaningful and
should be rejected.

We simply include an if-else statement that determines if the
Collection passed in is an empty Set<String>.

EditCommandParserTest#parse_resetTags_success() has been changed to
parse_resetTags_failure() since the behavior that it is testing for
no longer exists and "t/" as an empty input is now invalid.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated ParserUtil#parseTags() method and EditCommand#getTags() method.
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the "edit" command does not allow users to delete any of
the existing Tag Types.

We should allow users some flexibility to delete some of the
existing Tag Types.

Let's start by implementing a way to delete Generic Tags with the
Tag Type JobScope.

EditCommandParserTest#parse_resetTags_success() created.

InternApply now runs successfully run all 267 tests
(Test passed:267 of 267 tests).

There is still no way to delete exiting Priority Tags or Application
Status Tags. Inputs with empty "pt/" and "ast/" prefixes will be
rejected by the "edit" command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modified EditCommand#execute() such that it no longer shows all Applications.
Overloaded an existing method in Model.java and ModelManager.java.
commitResults.messageBody:
Now when calling updateFilteredApplicationList() without providing
a predicate, a ModelManager object will instead reuse the
previously used predicate stored locally as currentFilter.

EditCommand#execute() has been modified to use the new
updateFilteredApplicationList() method.

Now, when `edit` is called after `find`, the list of applications
shown in the Main Window will not revert back the showing the full
list of all applications. Instead, the previously used filter, in
this case the filter used for `find` command, will be used instead.

This will solve the issue #200.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated the ModelStub used in AddCommandTest.java to override the new updateFilteredApplicationList() method.
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a line in the EditCommandTest#execute_filteredList_success()
method that refreshes the currentFilter of the model object to
PREDICATE_SHOW_ALL_APPLICATIONS so that it correctly test for the
successful execution of the command.

InternApply now runs successfully all 267 tests
(Test passed:267 of 267 tests).

Modified ParserUtil#parseTags() method to only accept alphanumeric
and non empty Tag inputs.

Modified EditCommand#getTags() method such that when "REMOVE" is
passed in as an argument for the prefix "t/", it will remove all
generic tags from the specified application to edit.

"REMOVE" is case insensitive so "remove" or "Remove" etc. will also
trigger the same behavior.

commitResults.messageTitle: Now considers "REMOVEPRIORITY" as a special case where priority tags will be wiped if "t/REMOVEPRIORITY" is inputted.
commitResults.messageBody:
findMatchAndCopy() method now checks for "REMOVEPRIORITY" and
ignores it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Now considers "REMOVESTATUS" as a special case where application status tags will be wiped if "t/REMOVESTATUS" is inputted.
commitResults.messageBody:
findMatchAndCopy() method now checks for "REMOVESTATUS" and
ignores it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test case for parse_resetTags_success() has been changed to test for failure instead. This is because "t/" is no longer recognized as a valid input.
Update the EditApplicationDescriptorBuilder.java to also include Job Title and Detail.
commitResults.messageBody:
EditCommandTest#execute_duplicateApplicationUnfilteredList_failure()
fixed such that the command execute will correctly result in
failure.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update to DG, Storage UML Diagram and SettingUp.md
Revert "Update to DG, Storage UML Diagram and SettingUp.md"
